page.title: 09ARRETON MANOR, ARRETON
page.content: Arreton Manor is the home of Claus Schroeder and is open to the public. It is a popular tourist attraction on the Isle of Wight. It is listed as a building of special architectural and historic merit. The Manor House is pleasantly situated in rural surroundings sited comfortably at the foot of Arreton down. There has been a Manor House on the site since its mention in the domesday book of 1086. It was rebuilt during 1595-1612 but retained part of a 14th century building. The Manor House is typically late Elizabethan-early Jacobean with two projecting wings and a central porch. The various rooms which the visitor sees, with the exception of the library, are furnished with late Elizabethan and early to late 17th century pieces.
